entry.title: chrome.history.search maxResults only accepts < 32 bit ints
entry.content:
[demo](https://play.web-extensions.dev/#)
Our documentation and error messages say that `maxResults` takes an integer. But it is more restrictive - it only takes numbers up to the positive signed 32 bit int. In Firefox, they take [Number.MAX_SAFE_INTEGER](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number/MAX_SAFE_INTEGER) (2^52)

entry.title: Undo button does not work after applying theme in fullscreen when “Always show toolbar in fullscreen” is disabled
entry.content:
Chrome Version: 123.0.6312.2 (Official Build) canary (arm64) ee77acc178bb8175e0f0b1967d1bd0bbcc9d5a82-refs/branch-heads/6312@{#6}
OS: Mac(11.4)
Feature Bug : https://issues.chromium.org/issues/326422875
Test Plan - https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ED_otHAVJCpb_-5VqeO67F1673aHRO6HUwvQwxZOBjw/ ￼ Precondition : launching Chrome with --enable-features="ImmersiveFullscreen" #enable-immersive-fullscreen-toolbar from chrome://flags
What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Launch Chrome open any theme from chrome web store 2. Disable “Always show toolbar in fullscreen” 3. Enter full screen 4. Click on Add to Chrome 5. After applying theme, click on “undo” button at the top 6. Observe that “undo” button is not working
Actual Result : Undo button does not work after applying theme in fullscreen when “Always show toolbar in fullscreen” is disabled
Expected Result : Undo button must work after applying theme in fullscreen when “Always show toolbar in fullscreen” is disabled
Kindly refer the screencasts below
Actual : https://drive.google.com/file/d/1u3im-kGN_KdT-JwByHzqdKPwWhiNyd_x/view?usp=drive_link
Expected : https://drive.google.com/file/d/1s4VhjJjS08NW_YmnstkUwdI1kklAg9O-/view?usp=drive_link
@bur : Could you please look into this.
Thanks!

entry.title: The USB/ HID device logs disappear after a period of inactivity
entry.content:
We recently launched a new program in JP, called the ChromeOS Release Champions, which formalizes ChromeOS Beta channel testing with partners/distributors/oems/odms. This bug is being filed as part of this program due to a report from the partner. Feedback report link: https://listnr.corp.google.com/product/208/report/91561529954
Description #releasechampion-commercial #domain-veolia.com The user noticed the USB/ HID device logs disappear after a period of inactivity, but the docking station and other peripherals connected to it work (shared screen, webcam, audio). After plugging and unplugging the docking station a few times, something appears in (URL: 1) The user is embarrassed because he is developing a Chrome app with chrome.usb and sees the same behavior with this method.
Product description is given in the feedback report: # FeedbackMonLink: https://healthmon.chromeos.goog/feedback/91561529954 open_in_new CHROME VERSION: 122.0.6261.35 beta CHROMEOS_ARC_ANDROID_SDK_VERSION: 33 CHROMEOS_ARC_STATUS: enabled CHROMEOS_AUSERVER: (URL: 4) CHROMEOS_BLUETOOTH_FLOSS: enabled CHROMEOS_RELEASE_BOARD: brya-signed-mp-v14keys CHROMEOS_RELEASE_DESCRIPTION: 15753.24.0 (Official Build) beta-channel brya CHROMEOS_RELEASE_TRACK: beta-channel CHROMEOS_RELEASE_VERSION: 15753.24.0 ENTERPRISE_ENROLLED: Managed hardware_class: ANAHERA-TYOO C5Q-B3J-G4F-673-U2F-B8E-A5W
Additional details can be found in the feedback link provided above.

entry.title: Make the storage access API work when WebView 3PCs are disabled
entry.content:
WebView gates 3PC access through our own [restricted cookie manager proxy](https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:android_webview/browser/network_service/aw_proxying_restricted_cookie_manager.h). If 3PCs are disabled, it just doesn't bother sending the response to the restricted cookie manager which means the storage access won't work as expected.
We've been working on adding additional checks to account for these corner cases but the correct approach is to feed an override for setting cookies like we did for [getting cookies](https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5317989) so that the underlying restricted cookie manager can deal with these values.

entry.title: Device emulation doesn't affect the navigator.platform value
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Open developer tools on any page an enable the device emulation. 2. Select some Android device, for example Moto G Power. 3. In the console, check that the navigator.platform value is no correct, it remains the original one for the host machine.
# Problem Description When emulating a certain device, the browser already adjusts a lot of different properties like: viewport dimensions, user agent and window.devicePixelRatio. It seems to me like the navigator.platform should also be affected, but it isn't.
I think the device emulation should mimic the target environment as closely as possible. Right now, I'm still getting "MacIntel" when emulating Android devices.
All that said, the main reason is a bit different to be honest. I have recently uncovered thousands of websites that target "navigator.platform == 'Linux x86_64'" to cheat performance metrics. They contain scripts that would bail from loading resources, inject LCP hacks or even call document.close() when seeing Linux x86_64. This is usually to fool PageSpeed Insights/GTmetrix and other performance testing tools in order to sell "performance optimisation" services.
My hope is that aligning the value of navigator.platform to the emulated device will stop existing cheats from being applied and make it harder to come up with new ones in the future.
I can see that the navigator.platform was already reduced as a part of this task https://issues.chromium.org/issues/40855169 which should theoretically make this work simpler(?).
# Summary Device emulation doesn't affect the navigator.platform value
# Additional Data Category: Developer Tools \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: No

entry.title: Disabling cookies might be broken with multi profile
entry.content: Developers can enable/disable cookies entirely in WebView with the [CookieManager#setAcceptCookie](https://developer.android.com/reference/android/webkit/CookieManager) API. This is ultimately fed to a [AwCookieAccessPolicy](https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:android_webview/browser/aw_cookie_access_policy.h;drc=4dbc034a20d71ba93b61d60d1d26526d6d8cc1c1) singleton that doesn't seem to be associated with the AwBrowserContext so it probably isn't respecting the profile and is likely set to whatever was last configured.

entry.title: #search part of URI when opening a PDF document
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Open any PDF document with #search in URI The search pattern is not highlighted 2. 3.
# Problem Description Hi Team,
We were using IE , Now migrated our app to chrome. We deal with lot of PDF and pass Search terms as part of URI. In IE there used to be a navigation pane with the search filter applied along with search terms highlighted. This was very helpful and reduced our work load of manually copying large numbers/string and search with ctrl+f. Since we use a lot of documents in our daily activities, these increases our work. Please can you support the feature of #search in chrome's inbuilt PDF viewer. Right now Mozilla supports it(Adobe pdf.js)
# Summary #search part of URI when opening a PDF document
# Custom Questions #### Which component does this fall under? Not sure - I don't know
#### Does this work in other browsers? Yes - This is just a Chrome problem
# Additional Data Category: API \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: No

entry.title: Fuzzing corpus zips not being updated
entry.content:
As Brendon noted, `latest.zip` (and other zips) in the [corpus backup bucket](https://pantheon.corp.google.com/storage/browser/clusterfuzz-libfuzzer-backup/corpus/libfuzzer/boringssl_read_pem_fuzzer;tab=objects?prefix=&forceOnObjectsSortingFiltering=false) are not being updated.
If nothing else, this will make the fuzzing coverage dashboard show out of date results (e.g. not reflective of new fuzzers).

entry.title: --reset-results on web platform tests with variants does not create the correct -expected.txt files
entry.content:
If you have a CL with failing web platform tests that use the [variants feature](https://web-platform-tests.org/writing-tests/testharness.html#variants), then `run_web_tests.py` with `--reset-results` will not create the correct `-expected.txt` files. The correct files seem to have the filename of `testname_variantname-expected.txt`, and there should be one per variant. The created files are just `testname-expected.txt`, and there is only one. (It's not clear which variant was run to create that file.)
A sample of such variant-using and currently-failing tests can be found by patching in https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5318859. Patchset 5 shows the result of
``` ./third_party/blink/tools/run_web_tests.py -t Default --no-retry-failures --reset-results virtual/close-watcher/external/wpt/close-watcher ```
whereas patchset 6 shows the manually-created `-expected.txt` files that I am hopeful will pass CQ.

entry.title: Widevine Video renders incorrectly beyond certain container size
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. visit https://v.qq.com/x/cover/v2098lbuihuqs11/u00315w81xn.html (you probbaly need ip in China mainland) 2. click fullscreen or make page size large enough 3. video was rendered on top of every thing and not respecting zindex
# Problem Description The widevine content is rendered to an incorrect "layer" when content dimension beyond certain size. It also seems not directly caused by HTMLVideoElement since we only encountered this issue in this site.
Also this issue only found on Chrome 122, with widevine content. And element highlighting also prove that the video frame rendered is not actually "on" the video element, you can check the attached image
# Summary Widevine Video renders incorrectly beyond certain container size
# Custom Questions #### Does this work in other browsers?
Yes - This is just a Chromium problem
# Additional Data Category: Audio / Video \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: Yes

entry.title: error accessing java files from other packages to my custom application file
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. create a new java file at "org.chromium.chrome.browser.base/" which extends splitchromeapplication. update the appliation file in androidmanifest.xml 2. access java files from different package ex: "org.chromium.chrome.browser.tab" 3. compile using autoninja -C out/Release chrome_public_apk
# Problem Description I created a custom application java file which extends the SplitChromeApplication.java. this MyApplication file access java class from other package outside from its. own package. while doing so. it throws error while compiling . package does not exists.
error:
autoninja -C out/Release chrome_public_apk ninja: Entering directory `out/Release' [1/165] ACTION //chrome/android:base_module_java__compile_java(//build/toolchain/android:android_clang_arm64) FAILED: obj/chrome/android/base_module_java.javac.jar obj/chrome/android/base_module_java.javac.jar.info python3 ../../build/android/gyp/compile_java.py --depfile=gen/chrome/android/base_module_java__compile_java.d --generated-dir=gen/chrome/android/base_module_java/generated_java --jar-path=obj/chrome/android/base_module_java.javac.jar --java-srcjars=\[\"gen/chrome/android/base_module_jni.srcjar\",\ \"gen/chrome/android/chrome_product_config.srcjar\",\ \"gen/chrome/android/base_module_java__assetres.srcjar\",\ \"gen/chrome/android/base_module_java.generated.srcjar\"\] --target-name //chrome/android:base_module_java__compile_java --classpath=@FileArg\(gen/chrome/android/base_module_java.build_config.json:android:sdk_interface_jars\) --header-jar obj/chrome/android/base_module_java.turbine.jar --classpath=\[\"obj/chrome/android/base_module_java.turbine.jar\"\] --classpath=@FileArg\(gen/chrome/android/base_module_java.build_config.json:deps_info:javac_full_interface_classpath\) --chromium-code=1 --jar-info-exclude-globs=\[\"\*/ProductConfig.class\",\ \"\*/R.class\",\ \"\*/R\\\$\*.class\",\ \"\*/Manifest.class\",\ \"\*/Manifest\\\$\*.class\",\ \"\*/\*GEN_JNI.class\"\] @gen/chrome/android/base_module_java.sources ../../chrome/android/java/src/org/chromium/chrome/browser/base/MyApplication.java:3: error: package org.chromium.chrome.browser.utils does not exist import org.chromium.chrome.browser.utils.PreferencesProvider; ^ ../../chrome/android/java/src/org/chromium/chrome/browser/base/MyApplication.java:7: error: package org.chromium.chrome.browser.auth does not exist import org.chromium.chrome.browser.auth.AuthActivity; entry.title: YouTube controls are not visible after entering full screen
entry.content:
Chrome Version: 123.0.6312.2 (Official Build) canary (arm64) ee77acc178bb8175e0f0b1967d1bd0bbcc9d5a82-refs/branch-heads/6312@{#6}
OS: Mac(11.4)
Feature Bug : https://issues.chromium.org/issues/326422875
Test Plan - https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ED_otHAVJCpb_-5VqeO67F1673aHRO6HUwvQwxZOBjw/ ￼ Precondition : launching Chrome with --enable-features="ImmersiveFullscreen" #enable-immersive-fullscreen-toolbar from chrome://flags
What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Launch Chrome and play a youtube video 2. Move the mouse focus in and out of video and observe that YouTube controls are seen when the mouse focus is on the video 3. Enter full screen 4. Try hovering the mouse over the video 5. Observe that the YouTube controls are not visible
Actual Result : YouTube controls are not visible after entering full screen
Expected Result : YouTube controls must be visible after entering full screen
Kindly refer the screencast below
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1B0RRq4OYAbd62abc2TF0Xwbo4x3RtlZB/view?usp=drive_link
@bur : Could you please look into this.
Thanks!

entry.title: [Regression] - Unable to play videos in Netflix Observed "Pardon the interruption" error
entry.content:
Chrome Version: M124 Canary #124.0.6318.0/15794.0.0 on Osiris(Brya) device Lacros Version: LaCrOS Canary #124.0.6323.0 [lacros only] OS: Chrome
Details: 1)Accounts: Test account and Corp account 2)Enterprise Enrolled: yes, logged in with corp account 3)Devices: A)Non-Corp devices - Osiris,Redrix and kano(Brya) -x86/lacros64 Guybrush(Dewatt) - x86/lacros64 B)Corp devices: NA 4) Repro on Ash-chrome: yes Repro on LaCrOS: Yes, 5)Mode: Normal Mode 6)Frequency: Always. 7)Enable the following flags from Ash Chrome (legacy) #lacros-stability = Canary #lacros-only = Enabled #lacros-availability-ignore = Enabled
What steps will reproduce the problem?
Launch chrome, Enable LaCrOS Launch LaCrOS Browser, Navigate to Netflix site, Log in and try to play any movie or drama, Observed "Pardon the Interruption" error message with error code:C7361-1253. Attaching the listnr report: https://listnr.corp.google.com/report/91586894388
Expected: Able to login to Netflix and play the video without any error. Actual: Observed "Pardon the Interruption" error message with error code: C7361-1253.
Note: Issue Able to reproduce on ash-chrome as well lacros
Able to reproduce the issue on lacros canary D-check 124.0.6322.1 using M124 Canary #124.0.6318.0/15794.0.0 on Guybrush(Dewatt) device - X86_arm 64
Issue seems to be Regression,as issue working fine in M111 stable 111.0.5563.152/15329.63.0 on lava(coral) device

entry.content:

# Problem Description Google Chrome starting to crash after updating to latest stable version 122 when tried to turn on sync on chrome profile, beta version 123 also have this issue. But version 121 is totally fine, can turn on sync and all data will sync back to me.

entry.title: Add test-only shortcut around UI for accepting suggestions
entry.content:
For Web Platform Tests and interactive UI tests, it'd be convenient to circumvent the UI.
For example, we could short-circuit the `AutofillExternalDelegate::OnSuggestionsReturned()` and `AutofillExternalDelegate::DidAcceptSuggestion()`.

entry.title: GoogleTest roll breaks deterministic builder
entry.content:
Once again, the GoogleTest roll is broken :)
https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5322074 landed with the following roll: https://chromium.googlesource.com/external/github.com/google/googletest.git/+log/76bb2afb8b52..9d43b27f7a87
This appears to have broken the deterministic builder: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Deterministic%20Linux
First failing build is https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Deterministic%20Linux/45890/overview And it went green after I landed a revert: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Deterministic%20Linux/45892/blamelist
https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/HEAD/docs/deterministic_builds.md#handling-failures-on-the-deterministic-bots has some info about the deterministic builders, and I've attached the failure log so it doesn't get lost.
The only real interesting thing I can see is that the tests in question involve the `UNSAFE_BUFFER()` macro in some way or another, but I can't see how that would actually cause the non-determinism in question when GoogleTest is involved.

entry.title: Saving password doesn't work in emulator
entry.content:
In the following scenario, the Password Manager offered to save a password but didn't actually save it. Also, Settings --> Password Manager had no effect.
I guess there's a simple explanation (maybe wrong build config), but maybe it's a real bug.
Steps ([screencast](https://screencast.googleplex.com/cast/NjQwOTE2MzE1NTQzOTYxNnw2Y2Y0NzA1Ny04MQ)): 1. Build Chrome with the `args.gn` from the bottom of the bug. 2. Run the APK in the emulator. 3. Select "Use without an account". 4. Navigate to `https://rsolomakhin.github.io/autofill/`. 5. Fill and submit the password form. (The load time is long in the screencast.) 6. Select "Save" when prompted to save the password. 7. Navigate to `https://rsolomakhin.github.io/autofill/`. 8. Try to fill the form. - Expected behaviour: bottom sheet or keyboard accessory fills the password. - Actual behaviour: looks like Autocomplete saved the username and fills it. It's certainly `AutofillExternalDelegate` where this comes from. I stumbled on this in [this bug](https://g-issues.chromium.org/issues/325726832#comment8). 9. Go to Settings --> Password Manager. - Expected behaviour: settings open up. - Actual behaviour: nothing happens, terminal prints the error below.
The error when opening Settings --> Password Manager: ``` 02-25 15:11:32.451 31276 31324 E GoogleApiManager: Failed to get service from broker. 02-25 15:11:32.451 31276 31324 E GoogleApiManager: java.lang.SecurityException: PackageVerificationRslt: not allowed: pkg=com.google.android.apps.chrome, sha256=[32a2fc74d731105859e5a85df16d95f102d85b22099b8064c5d8915c61dad1e0], atk=true, ver=240315025.true 02-25 15:11:32.451 31276 31324 E GoogleApiManager: at android.os.Parcel.createException(Parcel.java:1942) 02-25 15:11:32.451 31276 31324 E GoogleApiManager: at android.os.Parcel.readException(Parcel.java:1910) 02-25 15:11:32.451 31276 31324 E GoogleApiManager: at android.os.Parcel.readException(Parcel.java:1860) 02-25 15:11:32.451 31276 31324 E GoogleApiManager: at com.google.android.gms.common.internal.IGmsServiceBroker$Stub$Proxy.getService(IGmsServiceBroker.java:292) 02-25 15:11:32.451 31276 31324 E GoogleApiManager: at com.google.android.gms.common.internal.GmsClientTracer.getService(GmsClientTracer.java:51) 02-25 15:11:32.451 31276 31324 E GoogleApiManager: at com.google.android.gms.common.internal.BaseGmsClient.getRemoteService(BaseGmsClient.java:1683) 02-25 15:11:32.451 31276 31324 E GoogleApiManager: at com.google.android.gms.common.api.internal.GoogleApiManager$GoogleApiProgressCallbacks$1.run(GoogleApiManager.java:1872) 02-25 15:11:32.451 31276 31324 E GoogleApiManager: at android.os.Handler.handleCallback(Handler.java:873) 02-25 15:11:32.451 31276 31324 E GoogleApiManager: at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:99) 02-25 15:11:32.451 31276 31324 E GoogleApiManager: at com.google.android.gms.libs.punchclock.threads.TracingHandler.dispatchMessageTraced(TracingHandler.java:257) 02-25 15:11:32.451 31276 31324 E GoogleApiManager: at com.google.android.gms.libs.punchclock.threads.TracingHandler.dispatchMessage(TracingHandler.java:214) 02-25 15:11:32.451 31276 31324 E GoogleApiManager: at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:193) 02-25 15:11:32.451 31276 31324 E GoogleApiManager: at android.os.HandlerThread.run(HandlerThread.java:65) ```
My `args.gn`: ``` enable_nacl = false is_asan = false target_cpu = "x86" use_official_google_api_keys = true is_debug = false blink_symbol_level = 0 use_internal_autofill_patterns = true v8_symbol_level = 0 symbol_level = 0 use_remoteexec = true target_os = "android" is_chrome_branded = false is_tsan = false dcheck_always_on = false is_component_build = true enable_expensive_dchecks = false is_java_debug = false system_webview_package_name = "com.google.android.apps.chrome" system_webview_shell_package_name = "org.chromium.my_webview_shell" ```
My emulator command is `/google/bin/releases/mobile-devx-platform/crow/crow.par --device pixel_3 --api_level 28 --arch x86` and the build target is `chrome_apk`.

entry.title: Chrome unexpectedly shows red screen and crashes. Since October 2023.
entry.content:

# Problem Description Chrome shows a red screen and then crashes unexpectedly, up to 5x per day. Used to be only when using Google Calendar, I would try to add an event and it immediately crashed, but now it happens when I use other applications too. Extremely disruptive for my work.

# Custom Questions #### How much crashed? The whole browser
#### Is it a problem with a plugin? No - It's the browser itself

entry.title: Drag and drop across frames in a frameset no longer working
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. This is a proprietary application that runs on my company's intranet. It has a left and right frame in a frameset and supports dragging items from the left to the right frame and back. This no longer works as of the chrome version above 2. 3.
# Problem Description In an application with an html frameset and left and right frames when you try to drag an item from the left frame to the right, the bounds of the frame are no longer respected. Instead of leaving the left frame and entering the right frame, the left frame scrolls horizontally forever.
# Additional Comments Attached video shows the issue. There is nothing new emitted to the console.
# Summary Drag and drop across frames in a frameset no longer working
# Additional Data Category: JavaScript \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: Yes

entry.title: [Chromium GSoC] Request for Feedback (analysis-tool)
entry.content:
For the Analysis tool, should I be looking forward in the direction of a CLI, something built inside the manage extensions page, or a Chrome Dev Tool integration? Also, i'd like to know if we are trying to analyze the extension based on the current website of only a list of a few famous websites.
For now, I have been thinking of a way for it to be implemented inside the extensions tab or make an option to analyze each extension
I think this would also let general extension users to analyze the extensions they have installed unlike CLI or a DevTool which might be complicated for them to access.
Thanks, Ananay

entry.title: Pixel Slate only supports Widevine L3 and SD playback resolution
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem On the Google Pixel Slate 1. Start streaming Android app such as Netflix 2. Go to 'My Netflix' -> App Settings -> Diagnostics -> Playback Specification 3. Here you see the DRM showing Widevine 'L3', Version '16.0.1@003', Maximum Playback Resolution 'SD'
# Problem Description Google Pixel Slate still only supports Widevine L3, resulting in streaming services like Netflix only having a maximum playback resolution of 'SD' with their apps. This is not a Netflix issue, but it is a Google issue.
At time of writing, with Chrome OS and the Netflix Android app for example, we're not at Widevine L1 which will be able to support HD resolutions.
Does the product/development team at Google have any indication that this is on their radar to update to Widevine L1?
Widevine digital rights management (DRM) protects content across three levels of security, simply named L3, L2, and L1. The Pixel Slate needs to be certified to meet the full L1 specification to be able to stream HD and HDR content from services like Netflix.
Because it is not, we're only getting L3, resulting in a device as capable as a Pixel Slate only pumping out a max resolution of SD.
Widevine is a proprietary digital rights management (DRM) system developed by Google. The Pixel Slate is a device made BY Google. I'm not sure what's missing here, as to why the device cannot go through whatever processes is needed to be certified :/
Yes, there is a workaround to use the web version of Netflix, but this is not a solution, because the app offers a better UX and other features the web version cannot.
# Summary Pixel Slate only supports Widevine L3 and SD playback resolution
# Custom Questions #### Does this work in other browsers?
Not sure - I don't know
# Additional Data Category: Audio / Video \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: No

Disable the chrome://flags/#chrome-refresh-2023 flag 3. Try to resize the window from the top. You can press your cursor within 4 or 5 pixels below the top of the window.

# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Crashes happen unexpectedly 2. Usually while on Hangout 3.
# Problem Description Experiencing chrome crashes since Nov '23. Chrome can crash up to 2-3 times per day, usually while on hangout. Extremely frustrating for me, my team and stakeholders. When it crashes, I have to reopen Chrome, open the hangout and rejoin. When I rejoin I can see that I'm still on the Hangout but it's my Teams photo, that disappears after a couple of seconds.
# Additional Comments I was advised by techstep to: 1. Use Chrome Beta, 2. Disable / remove Chrome extensions, 3. Uninstall / reinstall Chrome. 4. Remove Voice Control.

Later on that evening, chrome would freeze and I am unable to use other functions on my laptop and must force restart (happened around 4 times). Today, the saved group tabs in the bookmarks bar is disappeared but my freezing problem also disappeared.

entry.title: [Extensions] Extend tabs.query() filter with optional documentId
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Install extension with a content script and background 2. Open a tab (referred to as "tab A") 2. Send a message from content script of tab A to background and in background capture information about the sender 3. Go to any other tab, open a window, reload the tab, navigate away or do anything else to move away from tab A 4. In background attempt to query information about tab A document and find there is no reliable way to do so
# Problem Description This is a mirror of WECG issue: https://github.com/w3c/webextensions/issues/553
## Background
`tabs.query()` is not currently aware of tabs being navigated and moved around, so there is very little information to refer to the same document. Luckily, most use cases require querying info about the active tab, which happens to be the default behavior for this API. Unfortunately, some use cases require querying info about non-active tabs. Currently, the best way to match a document belonging to an inactive tab is to refer to its coincidental mutable non-unique attributes like its location (window id and an index on tab strip), its URL or title, which are problematic from privacy perspective.
## Problem
`tabs.query()` and other APIs under `tabs` are async and inherently racy. For example, the background may get a message from content script, call `tabs.query()` to get more information about the sender and receive a response containing information about a different document (because the tab may navigate between the message being sent and the `tabs.query()` being called).
## Proposal
Extend `tabs.query(queryInfo: QueryInfo, callback)`argument `QueryInfo` ([Chrome docs](https://developer.chrome.com/docs/extensions/mv2/reference/tabs#method-query), [MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/Add-ons/WebExtensions/API/Tabs/query)) to take optional `documentId` argument.
If developer specifies `documentId`, browser returns only the tab which currently hosts the corresponding document. If the provided `documentId` has invalid format, then an error is returned. If provided `documentId` is semantically valid, but browser is not aware of a document with this id, then nothing is matched so an empty array is returned (since this may be an id from an older browser session, tab open on a different device and synced via `storage.sync` or something like this). If the provided `documentId` corresponds to a sub-frame or a top-level frame currently sitting in BFCache, then nothing is returned to match existing behavior.
# Additional Comments Please assign to Chromium > Platform > Extensions > API
# Summary [Extensions] Extend tabs.query() filter with optional documentId
# Custom Questions #### Which component does this fall under? Not sure - I don't know
#### Does this feature work correctly in other browsers? No - I can reproduce the problem in another browser
#### Details of interop issue Other browsers do not support this feature either.
# Additional Data Category: API \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: No

entry.title: Right clicking (contextmenu) in bookmark subfolders does not work
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Create a bookmark subfolder with at least 2 bookmark items 2. Right click on a bookmark item in the subfolder -> There is a 25% chance that the bookmark menu closes. 3. If the bookmark menu did not close, right click on a second bookmark item in the subfolder. -> There is a 100% chance that the bookmark menu closes.
And when the bookmark menu closes on a right-click, the contextmenu of the element behind the bookmark menu opens instead. (Which is often the webpage's contextmenu.)
# Problem Description There is about a 25% chance that the bookmark menu closes when a right-click on a bookmark item in a subfolder is executed. And a 100% on a second right click on a bookmark item in a subfolder.
# Additional Comments I can also reproduce this in Chromium version 124.0.6321.0 (Official Build) canary (64-bit)
# Summary Right clicking (contextmenu) in bookmark subfolders does not work
# Additional Data Category: UI \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: Yes

entry.title: updater_tests_system fails with GTEST_HAS_ABSL
entry.content:
This happens with https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5321837?tab=checks patched in. I haven't managed to figure out what's going on here.
Example of a failure: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/try/win-rel/515453/overview
As far as I can tell, these use a helper "test" to do things, and the helper "test" is failing. ``` [ RUN ] TestHelperCommandRunner.Run [11244:5640:VERBOSE2:prefs.cc(142)] CreateGlobalPrefs [11244:5640:VERBOSE2:lock_win.cc(48)] Trying to acquire the lock: {A6B9ECD5-772A-4D3F-BFEB-CF9340534A3E}: System [11244:5640:VERBOSE2:lock_win.cc(52)] Lock acquired: {A6B9ECD5-772A-4D3F-BFEB-CF9340534A3E}: System [11244:5640:VERBOSE1:prefs.cc(89)] UpdaterPrefsImpl (global): C:\Program Files\Chromium\ChromiumUpdater [11244:5640:VERBOSE1:prefs.cc(94)] ~UpdaterPrefsImpl: C:\Program Files\Chromium\ChromiumUpdater [11244:5640:VERBOSE2:lock_win.cc(74)] Lock released. [11244:5640:ERROR:integration_tests_impl.cc(918)] Value of: base::Contains( base::MakeRefCounted<PersistedData>( scope, CreateGlobalPrefs(scope)->GetPrefService(), nullptr) ->GetAppIds(), app_id) Actual: false Expected: true Stack trace: updater::test::ExpectRegistered [0x00007FF64990945E+382] base::RepeatingCallback<int __cdecl(enum updater::UpdaterScope,std::__Cr::basic_string<char,std::__Cr::char_traits<char>,std::__Cr::allocator<char> > const & __ptr64)>::Run [0x00007FF64979BE12+242] base::RepeatingCallback<int __cdecl(enum base::RepeatingCallback<bool __cdecl(enum updater::UpdaterScope,std::__Cr::basic_string<char,std::__Cr::char_traits<char>,std::__Cr::allocator<char> > const & __ptr64,base::OnceCallback<void __cdecl(int)>)>::Run [0x00007FF64979BC3B+117] base::internal::DecayedFunctorTraits<base::RepeatingCallback<bool __cdecl(enum updater::UpdaterScope,std::__Cr::basic_string<char,std::__Cr::char_traits<char>,std::__Cr::allocator<char> > const & __ptr64,base::OnceCallback<void __cdecl(int)>)>,enum update [0x00007FF64979BB62+78] base::RepeatingCallback<bool __cdecl(std::__Cr::basic_string<char,std::__Cr::char_traits<char>,std::__Cr::allocator<char> > const & __ptr64,base::OnceCallback<void __cdecl(int)>)>::Run [0x00007FF649799F93+111] base::RepeatingCallback<int __cdecl(bool)>::Run [0x00007FF64979B9A6+438] base::RepeatingCallback<int __cdecl(bool)>::Run [0x00007FF64979BA97+679] base::RepeatingCallback<bool __cdecl(base::OnceCallback<void __cdecl(int)>)>::Run [0x00007FF64979937F+103] weak.AbslInternalReportFatalUsageError.default.?GetUsageConfigflags_internalabslYA?AUFlagsUsageConfig [0x00007FF64979708E+18430] updater::App::RunTasks [0x00007FF6499E1710+270] updater::App::Run [0x00007FF6499E15E6+34] updater::AppInstallWinHandleInstallResultTest_TestCases_Test::`scalar deleting destructor' [0x00007FF649791CE5+277] ```
``` [ RUN ] TestHelperCommandRunner.Run [16956:7384:INFO:integration_tests_impl.cc(946)] Run command: "C:\b\s\w\ir\out\Release_x64\updater_test.exe" --uninstall --enable-logging --vmodule=*/components/winhttp/*=1,*/components/update_client/*=2,*/chrome/updater/*=2 --system [10272:9832:INFO:server.cc(86)] Handle request at path:/update [10272:9832:ERROR:request_matcher.cc(88)] Failed Request content match failed. Expected regex: [.*"appid":"test".*] not found in content: There were a number of other failures on other platforms that have since been resolved: - non-deterministic test harness failures due to specifying --gtest_filter on both the command line and --gtest_flagfile (this does not appear to be happening here) - command line parsing failures due to ABSL_FLAGS_STRIP_NAMES being implicitly set (this does not apply to non-mobile platforms, such as Windows)
